original_solution_mapping.L2: Mom has given Olaf 5 more toy cars than Dad, so 10 + 5 = <<10+5=15>>15 toy cars
original_solution_mapping.L4: Uncle has given 1 less toy than Auntie, so 6 - 1 = <<6-1=5>>5 toy cars
original_solution_mapping.L6: All the family together gave Olaf 10 +15 + 6 + 5 + 10 = <<10+15+6+5+10=46>>46.
original_solution_mapping.L7: Adding the cars Olaf already had, Olaf's collection has 150 + 46 = <<150+46=196>>196 cars.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5897.
    Returns: the total number of toy cars Olaf has after receiving gifts.
    """
    # L2
    dad_cars = 10 # Dad gave Olaf 10 toy cars
    mom_more_than_dad = 5 # 5 less than Mum (Dad gave 5 less than Mum)
    mom_cars = dad_cars + mom_more_than_dad

    # L4
    auntie_cars = 6 # Auntie gave Olaf 6 toy cars
    uncle_less_than_auntie = 1 # 1 more than the uncle (Auntie gave 1 more than uncle)
    uncle_cars = auntie_cars - uncle_less_than_auntie

    # L5
    grandpa_multiplier = 2 # twice as many toy cars as the uncle
    grandpa_cars = grandpa_multiplier * uncle_cars

    # L6
    total_gifts = dad_cars + mom_cars + auntie_cars + uncle_cars + grandpa_cars

    # L7
    initial_collection = 150 # his collection consisted of 150 cars
    final_collection = initial_collection + total_gifts

    # FA
    answer = final_collection
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Mom has given Olaf {mom_more_than_dad} more toy cars than Dad, so {dad_cars} + {mom_more_than_dad} = <<{dad_cars}+{mom_more_than_dad}={mom_cars}>>{mom_cars} toy cars
Uncle has given {uncle_less_than_auntie} less toy than Auntie, so {auntie_cars} - {uncle_less_than_auntie} = <<{auntie_cars}-{uncle_less_than_auntie}={uncle_cars}>>{uncle_cars} toy cars

All the family together gave Olaf {dad_cars} +{mom_cars} + {auntie_cars} + {uncle_cars} + {grandpa_cars} = <<{dad_cars}+{mom_cars}+{auntie_cars}+{uncle_cars}+{grandpa_cars}={total_gifts}>>{total_gifts}.
Adding the cars Olaf already had, Olaf's collection has {initial_collection} + {total_gifts} = <<{initial_collection}+{total_gifts}={final_collection}>>{final_collection} cars.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Mom has given Olaf 5 more toy cars than Dad, so 10 + 5 = <<10+5=15>>15 toy cars
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Uncle has given 1 less toy than Auntie, so 6 - 1 = <<6-1=5>>5 toy cars
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: All the family together gave Olaf 10 +15 + 6 + 10 + 10 = <<10+15+6+10+10=51>>51.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L7: Adding the cars Olaf already had, Olaf's collection has 150 + 51 = <<150+51=201>>201 cars.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'grandpa_cars' (value: 10) was used instead of 'uncle_cars' (value: 5).
